did.abstract: Records, 1970-1976, of a University of Michigan library committee concerned with coordinating and proposing library planning activities. Includes summary minutes, reports, survey materials, and task force records.

bioghist.p: Frederick H. Wagman, Director of the University Library, established the University Library Planning Committee on September 1, 1973. The committee's charge included responsibility for identifying planning activities throughout the library, specifying areas where additional planning was required, recommending priorities among several planning activities, and proposing organizational patterns for future planning activity. The committee's work was concluded in 1974 when it presented its report to Director Wagman.

scopecontent.p: The Library Planning Committee records date from 1970 to 1976 and measure less than one linear foot. They include minutes, reports, survey materials and detailed records from two of the many task forces, which explored specific areas of concern.
